channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Staircase Cascaded Fusion of Lightweight Local Pattern Recognition and Long-Range Dependencies for Structural Crack Segmentation
item.description: The F1 and mIoU scores on the TUT dataset are 0. 8382 and 0. 8473, respectively, achieving state-of-the-art (SOTA) performance while requiring the least computational resources.

item.title: Memory-Efficient LLM Training with Online Subspace Descent
item.description: Recently, a wide range of memory-efficient LLM training algorithms have gained substantial popularity.

item.title: O-Mamba: O-shape State-Space Model for Underwater Image Enhancement
item.description: This branch includes MS-MoE for fusing multi-scale information within branches, Mutual Promotion module for interaction between spatial and channel information across branches, and Cyclic Multi-scale optimization strategy to maximize the use of multi-scale information.

item.title: VFM-Det: Towards High-Performance Vehicle Detection via Large Foundation Models
item.description: In this work, we propose a new vehicle detection paradigm based on a pre-trained foundation vehicle model (VehicleMAE) and a large language model (T5), termed VFM-Det.

item.title: Unleashing the Potential of SAM2 for Biomedical Images and Videos: A Survey
item.description: The unprecedented developments in segmentation foundational models have become a dominant force in the field of computer vision, introducing a multitude of previously unexplored capabilities in a wide range of natural images and videos.

item.title: Universal dimensions of visual representation
item.description: Do neural network models of vision learn brain-aligned representations because they share architectural constraints and task objectives with biological vision or because they learn universal features of natural image processing?

item.title: Reproduction of scan B-statistic for kernel change-point detection algorithm
item.description: Change-point detection has garnered significant attention due to its broad range of applications, including epidemic disease outbreaks, social network evolution, image analysis, and wireless communications.

item.title: Data-Centric Approach to Constrained Machine Learning: A Case Study on Conway's Game of Life
item.description: This paper focuses on a data-centric approach to machine learning applications in the context of Conway's Game of Life.

item.title: BoostTrack++: using tracklet information to detect more objects in multiple object tracking
item.description: In this paper, we identify the limitations of the confidence boost used in BoostTrack and propose a method to improve its performance.

item.title: MedDec: A Dataset for Extracting Medical Decisions from Discharge Summaries
item.description: Medical decisions directly impact individuals' health and well-being.

item.title: ml_edm package: a Python toolkit for Machine Learning based Early Decision Making
item.description: \texttt{ml\_edm} is a Python 3 library, designed for early decision making of any learning tasks involving temporal/sequential data.

item.title: LIMP: Large Language Model Enhanced Intent-aware Mobility Prediction
item.description: Moreover, we propose a transformer-based intention-aware mobility prediction model to effectively harness the intention inference ability of LLM.

item.title: T3M: Text Guided 3D Human Motion Synthesis from Speech
item.description: Speech-driven 3D motion synthesis seeks to create lifelike animations based on human speech, with potential uses in virtual reality, gaming, and the film production.

item.title: Enhancing Knowledge Tracing with Concept Map and Response Disentanglement
item.description: CRKT benefits KT by directly leveraging answer choices--beyond merely identifying correct or incorrect answers--to distinguish responses with different incorrect choices.

item.title: Multivariate Time-Series Anomaly Detection based on Enhancing Graph Attention Networks with Topological Analysis
item.description: Additionally, we present an augmented GAT to manage complex inter-feature dependencies, which incorporates graph topology into node features across multiple scales, a versatile, plug-and-play enhancement that significantly boosts the performance of GAT.

item.title: EvalYaks: Instruction Tuning Datasets and LoRA Fine-tuned Models for Automated Scoring of CEFR B2 Speaking Assessment Transcripts
item.description: In addition, new instruction-tuned datasets are developed from the English Vocabulary Profile (up to CEFR B2 level) and the CEFR-SP WikiAuto datasets.

item.title: Real-Time Video Generation with Pyramid Attention Broadcast
item.description: We present Pyramid Attention Broadcast (PAB), a real-time, high quality and training-free approach for DiT-based video generation.

item.title: Tackling Data Heterogeneity in Federated Learning via Loss Decomposition
item.description: To mitigate the impact of data heterogeneity on FL performance, we start with analyzing how FL training influence FL performance by decomposing the global loss into three terms: local loss, distribution shift loss and aggregation loss.

item.title: Generalized SAM: Efficient Fine-Tuning of SAM for Variable Input Image Sizes
item.description: The input image size of SAM is fixed at 1024 x 1024, resulting in substantial computational demands during training.

item.title: ssProp: Energy-Efficient Training for Convolutional Neural Networks with Scheduled Sparse Back Propagation
item.description: Back-propagation (BP) is a major source of computational expense during training deep learning models.

item.title: Aligning (Medical) LLMs for (Counterfactual) Fairness
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have emerged as promising solutions for a variety of medical and clinical decision support applications.

item.title: SPARK: Multi-Vision Sensor Perception and Reasoning Benchmark for Large-scale Vision-Language Models
item.description: However, we observe that current LVLMs view images taken from multi-vision sensors as if they were in the same RGB domain without considering the physical characteristics of multi-vision sensors.

item.title: GSFusion: Online RGB-D Mapping Where Gaussian Splatting Meets TSDF Fusion
item.description: In this way, we simultaneously generate a compact 3D Gaussian map with fewer artifacts and a volumetric map on the fly.

item.title: Generating Realistic X-ray Scattering Images Using Stable Diffusion and Human-in-the-loop Annotations
item.description: We fine-tuned a foundational stable diffusion model using X-ray scattering images and their corresponding descriptions to generate new scientific images from given prompts.

item.title: Quantization-free Lossy Image Compression Using Integer Matrix Factorization
item.description: Remarkably, our method improved top-1 accuracy by over 5 percentage points compared to JPEG at bit rates under 0. 25 bpp.

item.title: Enhanced Fine-Tuning of Lightweight Domain-Specific Q&A Model Based on Large Language Models
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) excel at general question-answering (Q&A) but often fall short in specialized domains due to a lack of domain-specific knowledge.

item.title: Towards Evaluating and Building Versatile Large Language Models for Medicine
item.description: To promote further advancements in the application of LLMs to clinical challenges, we have made the MedS-Ins dataset fully accessible and invite the research community to contribute to its expansion. Additionally, we have launched a dynamic leaderboard for MedS-Bench, which we plan to regularly update the test set to track progress and enhance the adaptation of general LLMs to the medical domain.

item.title: CODE: Confident Ordinary Differential Editing
item.description: However, conditioning on noisy or Out-of-Distribution (OoD) images poses significant challenges, particularly in balancing fidelity to the input and realism of the output.

item.title: Unrolled Decomposed Unpaired Learning for Controllable Low-Light Video Enhancement
item.description: To address the above challenge, we propose the Unrolled Decomposed Unpaired Network (UDU-Net) for enhancing low-light videos by unrolling the optimization functions into a deep network to decompose the signal into spatial and temporal-related factors, which are updated iteratively.

item.title: A Percolation Model of Emergence: Analyzing Transformers Trained on a Formal Language
item.description: Increase in data, size, or compute can lead to sudden learning of specific capabilities by a neural network -- a phenomenon often called "emergence".

item.title: UMAD: University of Macau Anomaly Detection Benchmark Dataset
item.description: To our best knowledge, this is the first benchmark dataset designed specifically for anomaly detection with reference in robotic patrolling scenarios, e. g., where an autonomous robot is employed to detect anomalous objects by comparing a reference and a query video sequences.

item.title: SLM Meets LLM: Balancing Latency, Interpretability and Consistency in Hallucination Detection
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) are highly capable but face latency challenges in real-time applications, such as conducting online hallucination detection.

item.title: UMERegRobust -- Universal Manifold Embedding Compatible Features for Robust Point Cloud Registration
item.description: In this paper, we adopt the Universal Manifold Embedding (UME) framework for the estimation of rigid transformations and extend it, so that it can accommodate scenarios involving partial overlap and differently sampled point clouds.

item.title: Cross-Domain Foundation Model Adaptation: Pioneering Computer Vision Models for Geophysical Data Analysis
item.description: We explore adapting foundation models (FMs) from the computer vision domain to geoscience.

item.title: Show-o: One Single Transformer to Unify Multimodal Understanding and Generation
item.description: We present a unified transformer, i. e., Show-o, that unifies multimodal understanding and generation.

item.title: DRExplainer: Quantifiable Interpretability in Drug Response Prediction with Directed Graph Convolutional Network
item.description: DRExplainer constructs a directed bipartite network integrating multi-omics profiles of cell lines, the chemical structure of drugs and known drug response to achieve directed prediction.

item.title: Behavior Pattern Mining-based Multi-Behavior Recommendation
item.description: Multi-behavior recommendation systems enhance effectiveness by leveraging auxiliary behaviors (such as page views and favorites) to address the limitations of traditional models that depend solely on sparse target behaviors like purchases.

item.title: Adaptive Spiking Neural Networks with Hybrid Coding
item.description: The Spiking Neural Network (SNN), due to its unique spiking-driven nature, is a more energy-efficient and effective neural network compared to Artificial Neural Networks (ANNs).

item.title: Interactive DualChecker for Mitigating Hallucinations in Distilling Large Language Models
item.description: Additionally, current methods for knowledge distillation using LLMs often struggle to enhance the effectiveness of both teacher and student models.

item.title: Leveraging Information Consistency in Frequency and Spatial Domain for Adversarial Attacks
item.description: In this work, we investigate the effectiveness of frequency domain-based attacks, aligning with similar findings in the spatial domain.

item.title: GenderCARE: A Comprehensive Framework for Assessing and Reducing Gender Bias in Large Language Models
item.description: By offering a realistic assessment and tailored reduction of gender biases, we hope that our GenderCARE can represent a significant step towards achieving fairness and equity in LLMs.

item.title: Reasoning Factual Knowledge in Structured Data with Large Language Models
item.description: This benchmark allows us to investigate the capability of LLMs across five factual tasks derived from the unique characteristics of structural facts.

item.title: WCEbleedGen: A wireless capsule endoscopy dataset and its benchmarking for automatic bleeding classification, detection, and segmentation
item.description: However, a medically annotated WCE dataset for training and evaluation of automatic classification, detection, and segmentation of bleeding and non-bleeding frames is currently lacking.

item.title: Controllable Text Generation for Large Language Models: A Survey
item.description: This paper systematically reviews the latest advancements in CTG for LLMs, offering a comprehensive definition of its core concepts and clarifying the requirements for control conditions and text quality.

item.title: ISETHDR: A Physics-based Synthetic Radiance Dataset for High Dynamic Range Driving Scenes
item.description: This paper describes a physics-based end-to-end software simulation for image systems.

item.title: FlexEdit: Marrying Free-Shape Masks to VLLM for Flexible Image Editing
item.description: Our approach employs a VLLM in comprehending the image content, mask, and user instructions.

item.title: MDD-5k: A New Diagnostic Conversation Dataset for Mental Disorders Synthesized via Neuro-Symbolic LLM Agents
item.description: By applying the proposed framework, we develop the largest Chinese mental disorders diagnosis dataset MDD-5k, which is built upon 1000 cleaned real patient cases by cooperating with a pioneering psychiatric hospital, and contains 5000 high-quality long conversations with diagnosis results as labels.

item.title: Fair Augmentation for Graph Collaborative Filtering
item.description: Despite emerging regulations addressing fairness of automated systems, unfairness issues in graph collaborative filtering remain underexplored, especially from the consumer's perspective.

item.title: A Riemannian Approach for Spatiotemporal Analysis and Generation of 4D Tree-shaped Structures
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel mathematical representation of the shape space of such trajectories, a Riemannian metric on that space, and computational tools for fast and accurate spatiotemporal registration and geodesics computation between 4D tree-shaped structures.

item.title: Multiple testing for signal-agnostic searches of new physics with machine learning
item.description: In this work, we address the question of how to enhance signal-agnostic searches by leveraging multiple testing strategies.
